 025:     r"""Calculates the spherical harmonic :math:`Y_{\ell}^m\left(\theta,
 026: \phi\right)`.
 027:     
 028: .. math::
 029:     Y_{\ell}^{m}\left( \theta, \phi \right)
 030:     =
 031:     \sqrt{
 032:         \frac{2\ell + 1}{4\pi}
 033:         \frac{
 034:             \left( \ell - m \right)!
 035:         }{
 036:             \left( \ell + m \right)!
 037:         }
 038:     }
 039:     P_{\ell}^{m}\left( \cos\theta \right)
 040:     e^{im\phi}
 041:         
 042: 
 043:     Parameters
 044:     ----------
 045:     l : int
 046:         degree. Must be greater than zero.
 047: 
 048:     m: int
 049:         order.
 050: 
 051:     theta: double
 052:         polar angle in radians
 053: 
 054:     phi: double
 055:         azimuthal angle in radians
 056: 
 057:     Returns
 058:     -------
 059:     out : complex
 060:         The :math:`\ell`-degree :math:`m`-order spherical harmonic 
 061:         :math:`Y_{\ell}^m\left(\theta, \phi\right)`
 062: 
 063:     """

PyDoc_STRVAR(__pyx_doc_4aftk_5model_14eigenfunctions_Tk, "Tk(int k, double theta, double phi, double eta) -> ndarray\n\n    Computes the matrix :math:`\\mathbf{\\mathsf{T}}_k\\left(\\theta, \\phi\\right) \n    \\in \\mathbb{C}^{2\\times2N_k}`.\n\n    :math:`\\mathbf{\\mathsf{T}}_k\\left(\\theta, \\phi\\right)` is a \n    matrix of spherical eigenfunctions defined by\n    the blocks\n\n    .. math::\n        \\mathbf{\\mathsf{T}}_k\\left(\\theta, \\phi\\right) = \\begin{bmatrix}\n            \\mathbf{T}_{(1, -1)} & \\mathbf{T}_{(1, 0)} & \\mathbf{T}_{(1, \n            1)} & \\cdots & \\mathbf{T}_{(k, k)}\n        \\end{bmatrix}\n\n    where\n\n    .. math::\n        \\mathbf{T}_{\\ell m}\\left(\\theta, \\phi\\right)\n        =\n        \\frac{\n            j^{\\ell}\n            \\sqrt{\\eta}\n        }{\n            \\sqrt{\\ell \\left(\\ell + 1\\right)}\n        }\n        \\begin{bmatrix}\n            \\dfrac{\n                -m Y_{l}^{m}\\left(\\theta, \\phi\\right)\n            }{\n                \\sin\\theta\n            }\n            &\n            \\dfrac{\n                \\partial Y_{l}^{m}\n            }{\n                \\partial \\theta\n            }\n            \\left(\\theta, \\phi\\right)\n            \\\\[2mm]\n            -j\n            \\dfrac{\n                \\partial Y_{l}^{m}\n            }{\n                \\partial \\theta\n            }\n            \\left(\\theta, \\phi\\right)\n            &\n            \\dfrac{\n                j m Y_{l}^{m}\\left(\\theta, \\phi\\right)\n            }{\n                \\sin\\theta\n            }\n        \\end{bmatrix},\n\n    while :math:`N_k = k^2 + 2k` is the number of spherical modes, where \n    :math:`k` is the degree of the highest mode, used to project the\n    radiation field as the linear form  :math:`\\mathbf{\\mathtt{\n    E}}_k\\left(\\theta, \\phi\\right) = \\mathbf{\n    \\mathsf{T}}_k\\left(\\theta, \\phi\\right) \\mathbf{\\mathsf{q}}_k`, \n    :math:`\\mathbf{\\mathsf{q}}_k \\in \\mathbb{C}^{2N_k \\times 1}`.\n\n\n    Parameters\n    ""----------\n    k: int\n        highest degree. Must be greater than zero.\n\n    theta: double\n        polar angle in radians\n\n    phi: double\n        azimuthal angle in radians\n\n    eta: double\n        medium impedance :math:`\\sqrt{\\dfrac{\\mu}{\\varepsilon}}`\n\n\n    Returns\n    -------\n    out : numpy.ndarray[numpy.complex128_t, ndim=2] with shape (2, 2Nk)\n        The matrix :math:`\\mathbf{\\mathsf{T}}_k\\left(\\theta, \\phi\\right)` as \n        explained above.\n    ");

 075:                                                      double theta,
 076:                                                      double phi,
 077:                                                      double eta):
 078:     r"""
 079:     Computes the matrix :math:`\mathbf{\mathsf{T}}_k\left(\theta, \phi\right) 
 080:     \in \mathbb{C}^{2\times2N_k}`.
 081: 
 082:     :math:`\mathbf{\mathsf{T}}_k\left(\theta, \phi\right)` is a 
 083:     matrix of spherical eigenfunctions defined by
 084:     the blocks
 085: 
 086:     .. math::
 087:         \mathbf{\mathsf{T}}_k\left(\theta, \phi\right) = \begin{bmatrix}
 088:             \mathbf{T}_{(1, -1)} & \mathbf{T}_{(1, 0)} & \mathbf{T}_{(1, 
 089:             1)} & \cdots & \mathbf{T}_{(k, k)}
 090:         \end{bmatrix}
 091: 
 092:     where
 093: 
 094:     .. math::
 095:         \mathbf{T}_{\ell m}\left(\theta, \phi\right)
 096:         =
 097:         \frac{
 098:             j^{\ell}
 099:             \sqrt{\eta}
 100:         }{
 101:             \sqrt{\ell \left(\ell + 1\right)}
 102:         }
 103:         \begin{bmatrix}
 104:             \dfrac{
 105:                 -m Y_{l}^{m}\left(\theta, \phi\right)
 106:             }{
 107:                 \sin\theta
 108:             }
 109:             &
 110:             \dfrac{
 111:                 \partial Y_{l}^{m}
 112:             }{
 113:                 \partial \theta
 114:             }
 115:             \left(\theta, \phi\right)
 116:             \\[2mm]
 117:             -j
 118:             \dfrac{
 119:                 \partial Y_{l}^{m}
 120:             }{
 121:                 \partial \theta
 122:             }
 123:             \left(\theta, \phi\right)
 124:             &
 125:             \dfrac{
 126:                 j m Y_{l}^{m}\left(\theta, \phi\right)
 127:             }{
 128:                 \sin\theta
 129:             }
 130:         \end{bmatrix},
 131: 
 132:     while :math:`N_k = k^2 + 2k` is the number of spherical modes, where 
 133:     :math:`k` is the degree of the highest mode, used to project the
 134:     radiation field as the linear form  :math:`\mathbf{\mathtt{
 135:     E}}_k\left(\theta, \phi\right) = \mathbf{
 136:     \mathsf{T}}_k\left(\theta, \phi\right) \mathbf{\mathsf{q}}_k`, 
 137:     :math:`\mathbf{\mathsf{q}}_k \in \mathbb{C}^{2N_k \times 1}`.
 138: 
 139: 
 140:     Parameters
 141:     ----------
 142:     k: int
 143:         highest degree. Must be greater than zero.
 144: 
 145:     theta: double
 146:         polar angle in radians
 147: 
 148:     phi: double
 149:         azimuthal angle in radians
 150: 
 151:     eta: double
 152:         medium impedance :math:`\sqrt{\dfrac{\mu}{\varepsilon}}`
 153: 
 154: 
 155:     Returns
 156:     -------
 157:     out : numpy.ndarray[numpy.complex128_t, ndim=2] with shape (2, 2Nk)
 158:         The matrix :math:`\mathbf{\mathsf{T}}_k\left(\theta, \phi\right)` as 
 159:         explained above.
 160:     """
 161:     cdef:
+162:         unsigned int Nk = k * (k + 2)
  __pyx_v_Nk = (__pyx_v_k * (__pyx_v_k + 2));
